place_description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.

reviews_data.review_text:
What a mess! Been awhile since coming in a Panera and this will be the last time! Like who thought that running a restaurant with a bunch of sloppy kids and no service was a good idea? It's a total disaster.
Ask for a cup because you ordered a drink?
Punch in an order and at 7:30 there are only 3 soups available out of the 20 they offer.
Cold bread bowl?
Close this place down!

Placed a delivery order at 5:15 pm.  Order # 6051715770177866 - Jeanne Russell.    When it arrived, Mexican Street Corn Chowder soup was missing but marked on the ticket as a part of the order, french onion soup had no cheese and was ice cold.  I called the store from 6pm until 8:30 pm and NO ONE ANSWERED!  Terrible customer service.  I even called another Panera store (which answered promptly) to find a regional manager to contact.  No idea from them.  This is the fourth time in a row where items were left off the order.  Need a refund and a new place to go for delivery food.
mop water all over the floor, with customers coming in and out ids not safe! It smelled horrible.
Worst Panera Bread ever, the order was 30 mins late and they gave my food to wrong person. Waiting another 30 mins to make another order but this time they make wrong order.

Disappointing. Small portions, and the Mac and Cheese was not even hot. The girl charged me $1 more than the menus price as well! Half the kiosks didn't work, and the counter wasn't any better. They were out of HALF of the breads they sell! The 2nd time this has happened.  Place doesn't seem clean either. Won't be back to this location again! Poor everything
Wanna buy this and eat it?
Nothing out of the ordinary here. Panera bread is always good, clean environment, feels safe and good place to talk business.

Today was my last visit. Very expensive for what you get. Cost $20 per person for lunch and there is no service. You are directed to order at a kiosk. Find a table and they they call your name. Food is delivered to a tall counter where you pick it up. At the end of the meal, you are expected to put your dishes away and clean your table. The food was good, but not worth the price, effort or lack of any service.
Soup is kinda pricey, tuna sandwiches had more lettuce than a spoon of tuna with tough bread. Looks small at entrance but plenty of seating space
The chunky Hispanic girl with long nails was extremely rude. I will not be back because of her.
The condition of this Panera was sub par. Extremely dirty.

Good food. It's kind of expensive.
Service is slow, and items are not in stock at the restaurant. Not very clean.

Yeah, my daughter ordered a grilled cheese and the cheese wasn't melted, I went up to buy her another and not only were they dismissive but the girl went back to the kitchen and was making fun of my daughter and I. When they made the new sandwich ( that I paid for again) I went to finish the Chicken Caesar and had a hair in it..so needless to say i didn't even say anything. As I was leaving I talked to another employee that saved this review from being a one star, he completely redeemed the place and I have changed my rating

The restaurant was very cold. Our soup was cold. We asked to get bowl heated up and they did but it was still cold, could not eat. We did get our money back. Lots of people standing around in kitchen doing nothing. Tables not cleaned off. Floors not swept. It's sad that staff are not trained to value their jobs and be the best that they can be on their jobs.
We had the best experience here. Panera bread is always good and this one didn't disappoint. It was comfortable for us to dine in and no pressure. Thank you

This is my last time coming to this Panera. I am an Unlimited Sips Club member so I'm in and out of a lot of Paneras. This one is the nearest to my barber and church. After church, they are usually out of creamer, which isn't always a problem because they are also frequently out of coffee. I've been here several times, including today, when the soda machine didn't work and 50% of time time the floor around the lemonade/tea and soda machine has standing water on it with no wet floor sign or is VERY sticky. The staff today wasn't even at the counter so i just ordered my drink at the kiosk, and grabbed a cup from behind the counter. Today was the 2nd or 3rd time that I've beeen here and the wifi has been down so I'm hotspotting my phone. For reference, I've been coming to this location for about 14 months. I'll find somewhere else to meet clients for coffee, knock out emails, and grab brunch after church from now on.

I recommend not ordering a flatbread, or, in the very least, not order one to-go.  The one I received was undercooked and slimey.  The box was packed underneath other items and smushed everything.  Pizza was doughy and bland.

Terribly dirty restaurant. None of the tables are clean, the surrounding areas are filled with trash and there are even seats that are ripped. The bathroom are also dirty with towels everywhere and toilets that do not flush. With this being said, I can't imagine how the kitchen is being kept either.
Bueno!!
It's hard to order in person. You have to use the kiosk in the restaurant.  I can not order online   It is getting ridiculous to order just to get a pick 2!!!
Food was good but this location needs cleaning.

Another example that not all Paneras are managed equally. Food is stale, clearly not well stored and poorly prepared.

Waste of money.
Food is good. Prices are high for this format restaurant. You are presented with a tip screen even though you order at a kiosk and pick your order up at the counter.

A group of us ordered  carryout totaling about $100. No silveware or napkins were provided, in the bags, food quite scarce and my mediterranian bowl that I order WITH extra avocados for $1.50 looked like this along with barely any chicken in a very clever very shallow bowl. I will not order from Panera again. Quality has gone way down hill

This place is TRASH and I'm shocked they're still in business. I had a terrible experience here a few weeks ago and was given a $15 credit to make up for it.

I gave it another shot for breakfast and showed up at 830am. Every SINGLE table was disgusting and not cleaned off, the one table with a power outlet has a totally loose power receptacle, and on top of that, NO ONE KNEW THEIR WIFI PASSWORD!

Food was mediocre, coffee was gross. And the bathrooms smelled so awful you can smell them as you walk into the store.

I'm officially never going to Panera ever again in my life.
Pretty fast service, lovely store front cashier and fresh food. Will definitely recommend.

Went to this Panera today, and everything was unorganized! To make it worse,  I had placed an order for the Turkey BLT Avocado sandwich,  and I don't know if it wasn't prepared well, but it gave me really bad diarrhea  x2! Keep calling the restaurant, and no one wants to answer. This is unacceptable. I need a refund.

This is a very inconsistent location. I will discontinue patronizing them AGAIN.
I placed an order online for the Pick Two. PB was out of my favorite sandwich so I then chose the Toasted Frontega Chicken Sandwich. I received a sandwich with about 3 really tiny pieces of chicken on it. It was mostly without chicken. Online they showed availability of my favorite soup, but when I arrived, they were out of the soup and also out of the Baguette. I then selected the chicken noodle soup that was mostly broth.  I would certainly not have gone there knowing they didn't have anything I really wanted and to receive such a poor meal to top it off. What a waste AGAIN.

One of the worst experiences I've ever encountered. My husband and I are Sip Club members and have been for over a year. We visit this location every morning. The staff and other patrons know us. However, this morning my husband and I were yelled at by a male staff member because he didn't hear me say "good morning" when we asked for our coffee cups (because they hide the cups behind the counter). He then decided to tell the whole restaurant that my husband and I were stealing the coffee, even though he just watched us order our coffee through the self-service kiosks and we showed him our email confirmations of our coffee orders.

This is not the first time this man or other employees have been rude to us or other customers. The coffee is almost always out of stock and pastries are stale. This location needs a lot of help.

Delicious!!!! I swear you can never go wrong with a pick 2! Tried a random pick and wasn't disappointed.  They didn't have the mozzarella, but the cheddar was cool. Had the Green Goddess sandwich and the evr so amazingly tasty Broccoli Cheddar soup with bread. I know... I should have grabbed an apple, lol. Got the sugar-free Blood Orange drink ... it was ok... topped it with some green tea and lemonade... etc. I like to mix flavors. The service was good. The "Bread maker" had the most bubbly vibes.
The only thing I didn't like was a guest (who apparently is an employee) kept blowing (their/his?) vape into the pick-up window. I was glad I had my food prior to their arrival. Otherwise, I enjoyed the clean sitting area. The traffic was steady, but the waits were not unbearable. I'll definitely return.
Food was ok, service was not friendly and tables were dirty, we ended up eating outside

I didn't read far enough down in the reviews to see that the manager (Ryan or Bryan?)  is a bad example of Panera excellence.  The Hispanic girl at the front desk who took my order had a beautiful personality and was kind and sweet. The manager was the DIRECT OPPOSITE. New management overhaul is badly needed here. Find another Panera Bread to frequent....... It was a headache paying a high price for decent food and receiving shabby service. I will never eat here again.
I love this location. They were quick and food was nice and fresh.... Gio was amazing

I had to change my review from a 5 to a 4. The bathrooms need some upkeep based on two trips to this Panera bread.

The seating area is expansive with dispersed seating areas; no loud music! Good place to read or study.
Love the Mediterranean sandwich  and the bear claw

Yikes, I hope this improves. We have always been big fans of Panera - the food is delicious and the list of chemical additives they don't allow is a huge relief. But the last time I visited the Cotswiold location there was no one behind the counter to take orders - I guess they just want people to use iPads, which for me is a lousy experience. Almost all the tables were dirty and about half had uncleared dished on them. Yes, customers should bus their tables, but if they don't, have a little pride - it was gross. I am sure there a lot of dynamics at work here, but I ended ups wishing we had just stayed home.

The workers are very nice, they are a little understaffed so nobody is usually not at the front counter, but the screens are still working and are very easy! The food is great, but because they are understaffed, it might take a while. It's a great place to go with friends or get some work done while you eat!

Wow waited a long time for Mac and cheese thebread is hard and on top of that they gave me a dirty spoon for my Mac and cheese too much playing around and talking. Was my first time will be my last. Nothing is organized back in the kitchen. And the guy was picking up random spoons to see which one was cleaner. Food safety issue.
Update
So I came back on 4th of July before I went to work. I walk up to the doors and they were so dirty fingerprints everywhere. I walk in side the manager and an employee was talking together she greeted me but I didn't like the fact she complain to me about being open.
I order my food was out of the sprouted flat bagel so I got in whole grain bread. The sandwich look good but all I can taste is butter they had put a lot of butter on my sandwich. I couldn't taste the egg white or anything else on it.
Saw 2 young men cane in and get free drinks in their water bottles.
Will not be back ever. The whole time I was their nobody came to clean anything.

I have a severe gluten allergy; while I wasn't too fond of going somewhere with "bread" in the name, my friends really wanted to go.

I want to express my sincere gratitude to Alex, a remarkable employee whose dedication and assistance made my experience truly outstanding. As someone with a severe gluten allergy, finding safe dining options can be challenging, but Alex's expertise, attentiveness, and unwavering commitment to my well-being surpassed all expectations.

From the moment I stepped foot into Panera, Alex greeted me with a warm and friendly demeanor. His genuine concern for my health and safety was evident as he proactively inquired about my dietary needs. I was immediately put at ease by his knowledge and understanding of gluten allergies, knowing that I was in capable hands.

Throughout the ordering process, Alex proved to be an invaluable resource. He guided me through the menu, highlighting the gluten-free options available and offering valuable recommendations. His thorough understanding of Panera's ingredients and food preparation procedures showcased his exceptional expertise in catering to individuals with dietary restrictions.

What truly distinguished Alex was his meticulous attention to detail and dedication to preventing cross-contamination. He took the time to explain the potential risks involved and shared Panera's stringent protocols for maintaining a gluten-free environment. His commitment to ensuring my safety was both admirable and reassuring.

When it came time to place my order, Alex's expertise shone through. He patiently walked me through the customization options, carefully selecting ingredients and ensuring that my meal would be completely free from gluten. I felt valued and supported throughout the entire process, knowing that Alex genuinely cared about my well-being.

The outcome was a delectable and worry-free meal that exceeded my expectations. The care and precision with which Alex and the Panera team prepared my food were evident in every bite. I appreciated his diligence in handling my order separately to minimize any risk of cross-contamination, allowing me to enjoy my meal with complete peace of mind.

What truly set Alex apart was his remarkable empathy and genuine care. He went above and beyond to check in on me during my meal, ensuring that everything met my satisfaction and addressing any additional concerns I had. His compassion and attentiveness created an atmosphere of inclusivity and warmth, making my dining experience truly memorable.

Alex's exceptional service at Panera exemplifies his remarkable knowledge, dedication, and compassion in assisting individuals with dietary restrictions. His commitment to ensuring a safe and enjoyable dining experience for those with gluten allergies is commendable and deserving of recognition.

In conclusion, I cannot praise Alex enough for his outstanding service and unwavering dedication during my visit to Panera. His expertise, kindness, and ability to create a safe haven for individuals with severe gluten allergies were truly remarkable. Thanks to Alex's exceptional assistance, I enjoyed a delicious meal without any concerns about my health. He is an invaluable asset to Panera, and I wholeheartedly recommend his exceptional service to anyone in need of a gluten-free haven.

I ordered online and when the website said my order was ready I walked in to grab it. I didn't see it so I asked the employee who was putting orders together about it and she said that if it wasn't on the shelf then they were still working on it. She wasn't very nice in her response. I waited a total of 40 minutes and after not seeing the order I asked for a refund because by that point I had to get back to work. But even the manager told me she couldn't give me a refund because it had to be done online and she said it won't be done until the next day.. so I paid $25 for food I didn't get. I was late to work going back from lunch and I am starving.. I would rate this experience in the negatives if I could

Came around 5:45 pm, ordered a salad with modifications. The salad was beautifully done, ready on time (mobile order) and the atmosphere , while busy, was calm. I also noticed a full staff, which has really been a challenge in food service from my observations, but dining room was very clean from what I saw, prepped for the dinner crowd...snapped a photo of this value wall which I haven't noticed in other paneras. But I feel like tonight's crew has hit these values. Well done.
Great place to eat, good and healthy food served there.
Walked in and it felt like the store was abandoned even though there was 5+ employees hanging out in the kitchen, doing nothing.. absolutely awful.

I've visited this Panera location multiple times in the last few months and unfortunately, the staff have been consistently rude on each occasion. I'm not sure if it is because they are short staffed and overworked or if key people left, but something is not working well at this location. This used to be my go to spot for studying and getting work done on the weekends. I will not be visiting this location again.
Horrible!!!! Avoid this location at all costs...
Great soups! I definitely like this place and will come back for sure!

On April 24th, I ordered a delivery order through the Panera app and upon delivery realized that my fiancee's meal was missing from the bag. We called Panera and explained the situation and they handled everything so well. The manager that was working gave us a refund for having to go out of our way to pick up the food that we didn't receive and then when we got to the actual Panera location, we were offered two free pastries.

We recently had a pretty intense drivers issue with DoorDash and it is just so great to see that Panera's customer service is top-notch.
Panera bread is the place that I go get comfort food. But I do not like the way they have set up the self check out system when you dine in

My family and I went today around 1:00pm today. Our order took extremely long to make and it seemed this location was very short staffed. The manager, or atleast whoever seemed in charge, was telling her employees to "stop playing around and help out"... after our order was missing a Mac and cheese for our 10 m/o, I went back up to ask for one. She handed (more like threw) me a cold mac and cheese. I asked for her assistance again politely and she told me to wait a few minutes again. Luckily some else behind the counter understood what I was needing. Very disorganized. Will not be going back to this location

The staff here is extremely rude. I placed a pickup order and the person sucked their teeth and said in a very rude way that I'm going to have to wait. I get that places are short staffed and have a lot going on but that's not okay to be rude when my order was $145+ dollars or just in general when someone is spending money with your business. I will no longer be using this location or spending money here ever again. I also asked to speak with the manager but clearly there was no sense of urgency to come and talk to me. Either way, I will never come back to this location due to their rude staff.

Don't waste your time or money going here. They need a serious overhaul of staff or to just shut down. When we entered no one greeted us even though there was 3 workers in the front. They continued to laugh and joke amoungst themselves as we placed our order on the little device. When our order was ready the lady at the pickup window had her hair all over the place no net or cap in sight. She was pretty rude as well. Our orders were not labeled so we had to open everything to see what it was. We did not receive our pastries so I had to go ask for them. The pastries were old, very old, and staler than the customer service which was pretty stale. The area around the pastries was not clean at all either.  Absolutely disgusting type of place. Will not be going back.

Hola Clientes y Equipo de Panera, el dia de hoy miercoles 1 de marzo, compre 2 tuna sandwich para mis hijos, el servicio al cliente y la ausencia de respeto de la senorita que atiende es mala, pero que me hayan entregado un pedazo de pan sin nada es peor.

No tengo tiempo para regresar con el pan, pague casi 27$. Es una decepcion

Ordered take out, food was ready for over 10 minutes and just sitting behind workers instead of in its pickup section. Room temperature at best when we got home. Bread was hard, chicken was cold. Disappointed and won't be coming back.
If you don't want to be in business to serve food, then just close it down! Rude, spiteful staff.
Signed up to  use the app to place order, and someone used my credit card to order food from the app in another city IN.

Panera food is usually very good. Wait time for our order was more than 30 minutes. Then they told me the item I ordered for my husband was not available. They said I could have a refund, but their ability to issue my refund was not available & I would have to wait a day or two to get the refund. I said ok & tried to order my husband a grilled cheese, but was told they couldn't expedite the order for me, even though we had been waiting for our original order for so long.
Placed and order at the kiosk anf they claim the order was never placed and I had to demand a refund. I was 3 seconds from calling my bank and the police.

In the small two stall bathroom there are 13 signs asking people to keep 'bodily fluids including blood and vomit in the toilet'. I don't know what happened to inspire Managment to plaster the walls with that message, but I'm guessing it's a bio hazard.
Ordered door dash from this location I can't believe I barley had chicken on my sandwhich such a rip off
Did not disappoint

Normally I don't leave reviews, but this was bad. When I walked in, no employees were visible. Ordered at the kiosk, but it didn't want to take my card. Again, no employee. After I got it to work, I waited until my name was called. Go to pick up my food, no employee. They had my bagel on the counter, but no coffee cup. With no employee visible, I had to walk behind the counter and get my own cup. I would say this was horrible service, but it was just no service.
We didn't go there we pass by but Panera  Bread it has some good food and most of   the times the food is very excellent  the  parking good it's wheelchair assistance

The staff was really kind.  The food was terrible.  This was my sandwich.  I ordered the the chipotle chicken avocado sandwich without avocado.  I paid for extra cheese and extra sauce.  It seems to have neither, or any of the other ingredients listed.

I also ordered plain Mac and cheese and got cold Mac and cheese with veggies in it.  No thanks.  Sad when the best part of a $20 meal is the Dr. Pepper.

such a great place , cashier e and k are such good employees and tend to do their job fast and effectively . highly recommended this place , definitely short staffed so please be a little patient but overall great service.

Panera used to be one of my favorite restaurants. But their quality, score sanitation, and food are going down. The soup was cold, the bread hard. Anyway, I go there once in a while to see if there are any changes.
Low on kitchen help but if you are not in a hurry good place to eat . We had the soup and half sandwich which was perfect on a cold ,cloudy day for lunch .
Went by for my lunch break an the service was great the food was fresh! Thanks a bunch ! Definitely recommend this great place
Best food best service

Everyone that I came in contact with was super friendly and the food was on point! The service that KC provided was memorable and I'll definitely be back to this location. I got the broccoli cheddar soup in a bread bowl, great quality and consistent to other locations I've been to. Thank you!
nice people, please clean your tea containers though
Bread was hard and oatmeal tasted burnt

Panera's food is always delicious that's why after a long hard day you pop in for a hot bowl of soup with the baguette. Yesterday was odd because Panera was not taking any cash at all. It just so happened that cash was all I had in my budget for food. I ended up having to go to PetSmart to get change for a $20 bill just so I could eat my dinner. Granted the cashier/server was amazing. News flash Panera, our society has not gone completely cashless, and until they do try to be somewhat accommodating with your customers who carry around cash still. There could be a very good reason why they have those strange green papers in their purses and pockets

I just want to give a huge shout out to the team at Panera in Cotswold for being so kind and thoughtful to my daughter last week. We purchased a smoothie and shortly after we left she dropped most of it on the sidewalk. With her in tears, we walked back to grab another straw and salvage what was remaining. The team caught on to what happened and offered to quickly replace the smoothie. A gesture that was certainly not expected but very much appreciated and one that totally made my 3 yr olds day. We both left with a smile. Thank you again!
I came on a Saturday. No one was working at counter. Had to put your order in on kiosk. The place was filthy. Drink station dirty. Never would come back.

Placed my delivery order and was charged. 15 minutes later I get an email canceling it due to driver issue. Money won't be back on my card for 5-7 days.

Poor service.
New spicy chicken sandwich is very good!

I had a very bad experience at this particular Panera Bread and had vowed to myself never to go there again. The.new cashier didn't know.how to let me order "You Pick Two" and the manager was busy running the kitchen and wouldn't come out to sort it out in a timely manner! I later contacted their corporate customer service and got a very empathetic person who apologized and promised to take corrective action. So I'm changing my rating from 1 to 3 stars.
People are kind! Service is great.
Short staffed compromises quality and service.

Went there early morning at 7 to use one of my giftcards which was never used and I received as a birthday gift recently. They swiped the card and said there is no money on it. I said that's impossible I've seen it when the card was purchased and the money was paid at the register at walmart. The manager insisted it's invalid and bought from a 3rd party therefore it's invalid. I've never heard anything like this before and I believe she didn't want to do it manually like the instructions said or she didn't know how to do it. Later on I called the 800 # of Panera to check balance and after I typed in the card # it showed me the balance of $15. I will never go to this location again because a manager who doesn't know anything is running this Store.

I eat at Panera a lot and the Sharon Amity location is my favorite. I saw there are older reviews about customer service and my only guess is that this may have been during the height of the pandemic. Every restaurant has had a tough time with staffing and I have learned to be patient and especially to be kind to those that are now taking on multiple positions at one job.
I have only had great experiences at the Sharon Amity location. The staff are super friendly and always get my custom order correct...okay, maybe one or twice it wasn't perfect but that is why I check my bag before I leave, even Chick-Fil-A gets my order wrong most of the time and I rarely go there.
Another point I would like to make: The NC minimum wage is only $7.25 per hour. Granted I have no idea what Panera pays but still it is not $100K a year so please be kind to people in the service industry. They are working hard to serve YOU. Jumping down off my soap box. Have a great day!
Took them a solid 30 minutes to get my sandwich, seemed pretty back up. Pulled some charred remains of something from the oven while I was there. Least my sandwich was still good
The bread is hard. Wish they would get softer bread.
I love the duet soup and tuna fish and soup and grilled cheese.

After a muti-Million dollar ad campaign, I couldn't wait to try the new chicken sandwich. I was greeted politely at the counter and Informed that the credit card machine was broke and it was cash only. After checking my pockets we placed our order. Me the signature chicken sandwich and my wife a Ceasars salad. After a short wait I was presented with a sandwich that appeared to be made in about 5 seconds. The sauce was so minimal I could hardly taste it, and the chicken? Cold to medium warm, looked like it was under the heat lights for the last 2 hours  and so dry it was almost inedible. Huge disappointment. I'll be back when everyone on the planet runs out of bagels.
Really nice spot for a coffee and a snack - great place to chill for a second and just watch the world go by.

food was ok although cold as the buzzer didnt ring and we were sitting waiting while our food was in the window, coffee was good tho just make sure you keep an eye on the window if theres no use of the buzzer. "yeah its probably out of battery"" ok
Disgusting. Get a new job if you hate your current one so much.
Ordered online and still had to wait 30 min for a grilled cheese sandwich and a soup. The employees clearly don't want to be there and it shows.

Ordered online and they completely messed my order. Both sandwiches which were supposed to be toasted were soggy. Also spent almost $10 on oatmeal raisin cookies alone and only recieved one cookie which was chocolate chip. Very upset. Poor kitchen staff go to the Southpark panera less than a mile away it is way better!
Not sure how you can mess up a two item order but sure enough Panera Bread did. Soup and salad I did not get my soup a total $28 via doordash. Tighten up Panera Bread, I don't have money to waste!

Friendly staff, good food
Been short staffed lately
Dine in not available on Saturday or Sunday
Always great

I understand you have the kiosks up front so that people can place their own order, but is it your company's policy for customers to be completely ignored? I went in today, Thursday, around 2:30 and there were two employees chatting up front. No one else was in line. I was looking at the bakery items and since no one came to help me, or even acknowledged my existence, I went over to the kiosk.  As I'm trying to place my order a foot away, they are both going on loudly about their personal lives, one of them stating he "didn't get this job to make friends"; he didn't get this job to do this job either.  I left without purchasing anything,

Amazing!
They have the best mac & cheese!
Last time I went I ordered a mango smoothie and it was delicious! Very nice staff! Definitely recommend!
Great customer service...... Rob is an awesome manager and really cares for the customers.
Great customer service and Rob is an awesome manager!!!!!!

I have a wonderful front-of-house experience at this location. I made a large, $125 order for pick-up and had the unfortunate experience of dealing with the back-of-house as well. The runner was pleasant enough, but I could overhear the "cooks" speaking to one another stating that it wasn't necessary to rush my order because I was 20 minutes early. Upon receiving confirmation for this order, I was advised that my order would be ready by 2pm and arrived around 1:55pm, their side of the order stated 2:30pm.

I spoke up after I overheard one of the cooks stating not to rush my order and spoke to my arrival time being 2pm upon confirmation. If Panera is going to have an "open" kitchen, it would likely be beneficial to provide them with some rudimentary Customer Service Training.

It is unlikely that my organization will order from this location again.

I arrived at the Sharon Amity location tonight about 6:45. To begin with they were out of what I wanted so I had to make another selection, ok no sweat right. I chose the mediterainian chicken bowl looks great on the board my girlfriend decided on the pick 2. A green goddess salad and mac and cheese. Well the only thing in the bag that was right, the Mac and cheese. Hot home put on some house clothes sat down opened the bag no chicken in my bowl sloppily portioned food stuff all over the sides of the bowl dirty lid to boot. My girlfriends salad nothing but chicken and iceberg lettuce and 2 tomatoes no dressing etc... Tried to call to inform them three times no answer. Oh, and EVERYONE including the manager were using their masks as chin straps and pulling them even further down to cut up with each other directly over the food being prepared. Thanks panera for your dedication to our saftey and less than stellar customer service and product!

The manager and every single kitchen employee on Sharon Amity had their masks down off their faces as they prepared and packaged the food. When home with the order, missing the chicken we ordered on the Mediterranean bowl, missing eggs, avocado, bacon, and the dressing for the Green Goddess salad. Tried to call the store repeatedly, it hangs up on you. Our only recourse  is to drive all the way back to ask for a refund.

So I ordered a whole Ceasar Salad and I got a chicken Chipotle sandwich.  The croutons was stale and the sandwich was a joke. They gave me a small corner bread as a sandwich. They charged all that money for this mess.
Un lugar para comer divino , pizza , ensalada , panes , un lugar calido con buenos espacios
Deserves zero stars. No in-store Ordering. Website isn't as easy to use as a menu board. Lost our family of 4's business permanently  :(

Check your bag before you leave on TO-GO orders at the Cotswold location.  They forgot one item which we caught before leaving, then when we got home realized they missed a second item.  This seems to be an ongoing issue with their training program.

Just dirty. I come here once a week in the morning around 9am, and it is consistently disgusting. Trash on floors, dirty tables, filthy bathroom, sticky food covered seats. I can understand if it's midday and busy, but it's always fairly empty inside at that time, so clearly there is just no effort put in to keep it up.

One of the slowest restaurants I've ever been to. The person expediting, who I am assuming was the manager was short with customers and had no control of the situation. Had no idea how long orders would take or where they were
I had to wipe down my own table. I asked  for a lil more pizza sauce for my pizza. I was told it was frozen.

Panera bread is always my go to place! But lately I've been experiencing missing items on my sandwich. I shouldn't have to tell the employee how to make a sandwich when it's on their receipt . I bought two bacon , egg & cheese with avocado and chipotle aioli. I paid 12.95 to received basically nothing on my sandwich and no bacon !! I expect better than this . During the making of my sandwich the cashier ebony  was touching another employee with her gloves on who was making my sandwich . Something needs to be done . As I would like to continue my purchasing here.
Soup after 10am

I am just home with my to go order of a chicken sesame Asian salad from Panera -Cotswold. I had to wait 20 minutes for my order due to staffing shortages. When I opened my salad there is absolutely no chicken in it. None. I have called to report this and no one will answer the phone. I will not make this mistake again. There are plenty of other Paneras in town.
I avoid ordering from this Panera as much as possible because there was not one order that they got right and they don't even answer the phone.
Ordered the flatbread pizza and found it was enough for two people.

Panera Bread is a great place for sandwiches, soups , salads and bakery items. The ingredients are always fresh and they are constantly adding new items. The staff is nice and the atmosphere is comfortable and laid back. Prices are a little above average but the quality makes up for it in my opinion. Lunch can be pretty busy but they have several self order kiosks which allow you to skip the line and get your food quicker if you're on a lunch break or in a rush. They also offer curbside pickup and delivery for anyone wanting to limit contact.

I was informed that I needed to order for a meeting at work (granted it was last minute and a rather large order) for 12 PM when I arrived at 8 AM. When I received my confirmation everything seemed good to go. Fast forward to 12:17 PM, the food was still not here. I checked the tracking and it said our order had been cancelled at 12 PM. I didn't receive a call or email informing me of this decision. I wouldn't have even known of the change if I hadn't checked.

In my opinion, this was very unprofessional and caused a great deal of stress on our end. I would have completely understood had they not allowed me to place the order or even contacted me when they received it to inform me of their decision. As it stands, I can't even get ahold of anyone on the phone to ensure the refund was processed.

I got the message that my order was ready. I pulled in the spot immediately after since I was in the parking lot. I waited 10 minutes on my order to come outside. I called no one answered so I had went in and got my own order. When I went in the workers at the pickup station we're just talking casually (not about Panera). It took the group of workers 4 minutes to even acknowledge me even though I was right infront of them. There was multiple people waiting on their order. Also a line to the door at the cash register. This happens a lot at this location. That's why I stopped going. It's seems like things haven't changed I won't be back.

Every time I order from this restaurant I swear it will be the last time. I ordered an classic grilled cheese and it turn out to be cold white bread with a thick slab of cheese - what happened to the Grilled part??!!

Such a Shame. we got there like at 7:30 and they close at 8:00pm there was nobody up front we were waiting like a good 10-15 min and I had to go look for someone so we can order. I got the chicken teriyaki and it was terrible! They reheated their old chicken they had! I know bc you can taste when something is not fresh. Yes your closing but if your not going to cook then close completely. If your letting people order then make the food fresh! My bowls had burn brown hard chunks of stuff all over and the chicken was beyond dry!! My husband was so hungry from working all day he just ate it and took out all the brown stuff out We are paying for a service and food is expensive! Everyone is nice the food was terrible. SMH!

3 Star review because my meal was good but my wife was treated poorly by the manager and cook. She wanted her egg made overeasy and it wasn't. She said both manager and cook said it was over easy to them. Not our usual store but our usual store she never had a issue. At our usual store I had a mistake corrected with no issues.
Excelente la sopa de Brocoli.

Had a turkey avocado sandwich with chips. It cost a bit too much considering what you actually get. I understand prices are going up due to inflation because of the poor way Joe the JOKE is running this country into the ground!!

I go to this location often as I love Panera. Every time I go, they get my order wrong. I have never once eaten here when my order was correct. I usually do the rapid pick up and they have to re-make my sandwich or something of the sort. I will continue to go to this location because It is convenient and I like the food, but It is disappointing.

Today I placed my order at 2:21pm which isn't rush hr. But for me My son ordered chicken noddle soup, grilled cheese and mixed fruit. Well we didn't check the bag to make sure everything was ok. However later to find and see everything was ok. However, I wasn't aware they put hot items in with cold items. So my fruit ended hot. Now I don't about anyone else but that's a nope for me if it's a fruit cup. Called back and was made aware they have always done it this way. So, I'm guessing I was wanting to much to have my fruit in another bag(separate). When I asked the young lady said it just as it was placed in the bag. So I just wanted to say Thank You Panera for MY HOT FRUIT CUP!! (never again)

I went to this location yesterday, August 16, 2021, hoping for a great lunch with my daughter on our day out. The smell of the location was off putting from entry. I should have walked out then, but, I gave it the benefit of the doubt. There was one staff working the register and another who seemed to be doing support stuff - cleaning buzzers. She had to be told to help with the busy, almost out the door line, by grabbing the pastry items for orders. No manager ever surfaced to the register area, even when the line was quite long.
I ordered 6 bagels, split and a tub of cream cheese to go; a pepperoni pizza and a turkey bravo w/ a fruit cup; kitchen sink cookie and a brownie.
The floor was sticky (thinking the stench was the fact that the floor was probably mopped the night before with dirty water that had sat all day), and it took about a 1/2 hour to get our food - dine in. I'd understand if it were lunch time, but it was after 1pm.
Did I mention the floor was sticky? The whole floor. I walked from the front register to a table in the back by a window. Even the carpet was sticky. The restrooms needed a good cleaning as well.
I had to go back to the front counter to get my bagels and cream cheese and noticed then that there were gnats in the bakery area. The line was still quite long and it was filling up in the dining area because people were waiting for their orders.
All the one worker did was get bakery items, so, not sure how it took her 15 minutes to split 6 bagels, but it did. SMH
The food counter: there was a worker standing outside the counter to hand people their orders. Umm, he would have been used much more efficiently in prepping the orders. It was a major manager fail to have him standing there doing nothing in between orders.
The food: I ordered a pepperoni pizza w/ onions. I know that they have raw onions. Did they put raw onions on my pizza? Nope. Made too much sense. Pickled red onions were placed on my pizza. Disgusting to say the least.
I didn't want to go through returning because it was already a hot mess. I watched a couple of people go get their money back and leave. I should have followed suit.
This location needs a lot of help, starting w/ a 24 hour shut down to totally clean and sanitize. Followed very closely by a new manager and staff who will understand what teamwork means.

Waited 20 minutes after my order was ready for curbside pickup. Called the store and no one answered. Called customer service and she called the store and no one answered so she ended up cancelling my order. The amount of bad experiences I have had at this location for the last couple years makes me never want to return to another Panera.
French onion soup was delicious and I had the turkey on the black pepper focca bread which seemed to enhance the flavors in the sandwich. I  had a delicious oatmeal and lemon drop cookie for later .
Not sure if the cashier was new to the job or lacked proper training.  Other than that, everything was fine.
Had Mexican Corn Chowder and got sick. Wont go back. Give them a 2 because staff was very nice.

Really enjoyed eating inside.  It was a bit hot out.  Had the greek salad & ten vegetable soup... yes, that's a hot dish,  but I let it cool down.  The break is excellent.   I'd recommend eating here.   Enjoy.
Very good store in a shopping center they would always have my food on time. I forgot to bring my covid card so i show cierra a picture of my vaccine card she gave outstanding service
Delicious

My first time eating here, all I wanted was a good salad, what I got was bag of lettuce, hardly no chicken, dressing, nothing I love Ceasar salad what I received was bad imitation of a Caesar salad,  when a lady return her food, I should had left, don't waste your money and certainly not your time, staff was clueless, very disappointing.
great service, the menu should be more varied

I have to say that I was never one who ate out alot. But I absolutely looooove the food at this location. It is so nice when I walk in and Liz knows my name.

I have a 30 min lunch time and they are always very efficient. The food tastes amazing especially their cranberry orange muffins from the bakery. Their pizzas are better than Dominos, Papa John's etc. Always kind employees from the register to making the food.
Normally I give 5 stars for Panera. But on this visit, my bagel was not sliced properly.  Since I did not eat it until I got home, there was not much I could do about it.
The place is disgusting and smells like trash!

This rating would be higher. However they messed up my order. They told me they would fix it which would have been fine if I hadn't already waited more then fifteen minutes for a simple salad. The manager who took my order read it back to me to make sure he had it right. However today they must have been short staffed because no one was making sure orders were right or being given out in a timely manner.

I worked with Jeff, the catering manager, on an order and he truly went above and beyond! I had an order request outside of their operating hours and he worked with me to ensure my needs were met and that we had the highest quality of food. Thank you, Jeff and the Cotswold Panera team!

The best word I can use to describe this Panera is...gross. I was there for less than 10 minutes as I was placing an order to go, but it was enough time to be left with a really bad impression. The drink area was sticky, dirty, and riddled with fruit flies. I could even smell the trash can through my mask (which is really saying something). Makes me wonder what the kitchen looks like.

The food was the normal "Panera Food," nothing to write home about, but the Mocha Drink we ordered had some kind of grease in it that my mother couldn't even finish it (See picture attached).

The facility seemed simply rundown and forgotten about. I would never recommend dining inside. The outside patio looked nice though....
Best panera bread in the area.  Clean and staff is friendly.
Great sitting outside with my favorite daughter.  Great black tea.
Every time I order curbside I have to go get my food myself because it takes them 10 min to even acknowledge I'm parked outside. And yes, my food is ready when I arrive. It's getting ridiculous.
Nice place for coffee or pastry..But I am having problems with their sandwiches...not enough meat and that goes for all panera breads
Clean quality and healthy food! Staff are nice and well trained!
No Greek yogurt, chicken, and chipotle sauce and they charged the same price this is unbelievable horrible experience never eating at this place again!

Terrible service!!!

Ordered from Doordash at 6pm. And it's 8pm now.

They are the slowest & worst service I've seen in Charlotte lately.....

my food arrived ice  cold,, it was disgusting!!! And when I called them, they said "they "forgot"

when I called them they brushed me off and acted like they didn't care whatsoever.
Terrible Terrible TERRIBLE cuatomer service
.....if I could have given them NEGATIVE stars I would have.

Great location with top notch customer service. The Management staff is always friendly and helpful. Even when the cafe is busy all are efficient and courteous. Thank you for strictly adhering to CDC guidelines and  continuously cleaning and improving to keep me safe. Thank you Ciara for always having a smile and positive attitude when I visit.

What a horrific place. Dirty. No selection of baked goods.  Came here 3 times in the afternoon , no pastry each time. Muffins and cookies only. Asian salad had no cilantro, stale bread. Not coming to this location ever again.

On a recent trip to Panera Bread, I was disappointed to find that the apple I had selected as a side for my soup came straight out the bag looking like this. I've never received the best looking apples from Panera Bread but this one took the cake. I understand that your choice of bread, chips or apple are made to appear like a courtesy side to your entree, but for the price of Panera's entrees, I know what I'm paying for. Not to mention, Panera has team members that prepare and check the bags contents for quality control - also what I'm paying for.
Great service and my order is always correct. The curbside pickup is so convenient and easy.
Excellent place the broccoli soup was delicious
Very good service!
The food and staff are wonderful! But recently I've noticed a real lax in cleanliness with the tables and floors, very dirty
This place its better than Starbucks coffee to be honest its way cheap and better, this is going to be my new place to eat on weekends.
Great place
Good

The place was dirty! the guy who took my order was clueless. If I had not questioned my order he was going to charge me $75 for a $40 transaction.
As for the people preparing the food, no one was wearing their mask correctly, nose exposed or used as a chin strap.
I will never visit this location again! This place needs new management.
Staff very nice

My table was dirty(again). The last time I was at this location it was dirty. I had a grilled chicken Greek salad. The chicken had no flavor. I think Panera has just changed. It doesn't taste good to me anymore. The people that worked tonight were great! I just didn't enjoy the food or the dirty table.
Curtious service and good food.

This location has declined tremendously. Waited 30 minutes for a curbside order and when they brought out coffee it was loaded up with milk (I have a dairy allergy and requested almond milk). They brought out two coffees at once without labels on either so zero precautions taken for allergies.
The Turkey sandwich is insane good. Wow.
Great healthy food (if you stay away from the sweets). They are always very nice to me here. Thank you!
They offered masks , and we're very professional about it. Very good customer service and amazing, consistent food experience.

I was really not pleased with the food/amount of food based on the price. Half a sandwich, a small bowl of soup and an apple. The bread tasted good but was pretty tuff. The chicken noodle soup was ok. I've had much better for less money. For two of us it was $26 bucks and that was a special deal.
Food is good and the place is clean, but there is always an issue with my order. This morning there were tortilla chips in my oatmeal?
Terrible service.
Great lunch on a rainy day

It's a very nice store and the staff are very friendly. The food is great too.. only warning would be that it can be extremely busy here if you're interested in eating on location. Last time I went I had to sit outside in the bitter cold to eat because it was too crowded in the restaurant and there wasn't enough seating. Not Panera's fault granted -- they can't help being popular, but just a general warning if you plan on eating in!
Love the frontega chicken!
Although it was crowded, still great food, efficient and friendly service.

This is one of the bigger and busier Panera Breads in the city.   This is a place that may be a little too boisterous to get work done if you are trying to sit at the computer.  The entire plaza seems a bit over ran.  This is a great place to go if you are really wanting to experience a crowd.
Great Service, will definitely go again
My family loves this place
I enjoy their quiches which are very popular, so visit or order online within a couple of hours of opening.  We have never encountered a rude staff member here.
The only fast food place I would dare to eat at.
The new vanilla cinnamon rolls are amazing!
Great service, smiling staff..
Always friendly prompt service
Love the food and good customers service
The Napa Chicken salad was very, very good.
The "GM" or the guy I see walking around telling people what to do looks homeless, his facial hair is unkempt, picks his nose and he sags his pants and gives the place a trashy look.
Perfect place for healthy eating, meet up point in and outdoor seating.only place of it's kind in this neighborhood
Your typical Panera.  Parking can be an issue (seems to be the norm around Paneras).  Friendly staff.  Good overall.
Always professional
Nice location.   Wish they had an Express pick up parking spot.  This lot can get crowded.
My salad was horrible
Great location. Food was brought out quickly. My only dislike was how dirty the dinning room was. Crumbs all over the floor and tables. Otherwise, its a great place!
Our son loves their Mac and Cheese.  I had chicken noodle soup and sandwich both very good.  Look forward to trying the new Breakfast Wraps.

I always go there, the attendants are friendly, the food is better then the other paneras (this panera come with a reasonable quantity). Of course sometimes they confuse the changes that I do in the salads or sandwiches, but it's ok, no big deal because of that.
However, the last two times that I visited panera (withing one or two weeks) my salad came with a big black hair inside, what I think it's disgusting, but I just took it out and continue eating, even that my apetite for that salad has gone already.
I like this restaurant, but I don't like the hair flavor in the salads.
I had the summer corn chowder and a cookie. It was wonderful. The service was friendly and quick.
Good food

It was good & the kiosks made ordering convenient, except they don't print out a receipt - you get one as you pick up the order. If for some reason the order doesn't make its way to the kitchen you have no way of knowing. (at least not until you've waited long enough to know that something went wrong.)
Love pretty much everything they have there and they are a completely clean food provider which is just an extra added bonus.

I ordered food for lunch. The bacon turkey bravo was delicious. The turkey was not those bland turkey slices that are usually  on the sandwich. The meat was good, fresh, and a little shredded not pulled.  The change is good  for my former favorite sandwich. Was that the right meat? If so, I'll order that sandwich more often. The summer corn chowder did not seem fresh; it tasted like last night's soup. Now let's talk about the fruit. Why did Panera Bread serve me a rotten apple? Is that healthy, fresh and clean? I can see the brown circles all over the apple.  And my lemonde expires on Wednesday, May 1, 2019. Is that healthy and clean? Please let me know about that.
Muy buen servicio geacias
Love taking my mom to this place she loves the soups...the bread is too hard for her but She still orders it. (Lol) friendly staff and nice atmosphere.
The soup tomato is delicious!!!
One of my favorite places to eat... They have the best chicken almond salad sandwich ... Delicious
Food is all nature and good. All nature drinks have to much sugar in them.
First time there was a good experience .

They need more help at this store! One employee spent 20 minutes serving one customer while the other employees wondered around in the back as if they were hiding from the front end. At one point, an employee commented on the size of the line and looked as if she was thinking about helping out but then opted not to. Unfortunately I was unable to wait due to having somewhere to be. Our presence was never even acknowledged by any staff there. Mediocre service. I'll be going to other locations from now on.
My bacon looked terrible and it wasn't the first time!!
Good food and clean sunny places to enjoy a lunch and conversation.  The workers are especially friendly and helpful!
Luv this place, I could eat there everyday
The old was good, but there was not enough seating available during the lunch rush.
I love the food of course, bt customer service is awesome!!!
Overpriced
The soup was delicious.
Great for a quick meal.
Love affair with Panera is definitely over. This chain has so much potential but their quality has come to an all time low.

I love Panera Bread and this one is no exception. The food is great and the atmosphere is perfect for a quick meeting or a long lunch. Its also a great place for getting work done out of the office while eating great food. Try the pecan braid, its the best!

Used to love Panera, years ago... Good coffee and bread offerings, but over time, was more and more dissatisfied with the food quality, and impersonal service, so I mostly stopped visiting.  Tried them again today for the first time in years.  Same Panera, same dissatisfaction.  Purchase overpriced food, wait until it's cold before it reaches your table (or walk up and get it myself while it's still hot), eat in cramped surroundings, take your dishes up to a dish station yourself.   You even get to clean your own table before eating.  (What service did I pay for that would warrant adding a tip to the purchase checkout screen?)   Ordered a 4 cheese croissant, which was served barely warm.  When I asked the staff member if they could heat it (in an oven or toaster) she pointed to the microwave and said I could do it myself.  Nothing like the taste of microwaved pastry... soggy and unevenly heated.  I also ordered a cafe mocha, and after the first taste, remembered why I go to Starbucks so often.  The coffee was warm not hot, drenched in a chocolate syrup that gave an almost medicinally sweet taste.  The whipped cream had mostly dissolved because it sat on the serving counter too long.
Great
Went there for my first time with my kids, and it was great. I tried the broccoli cheddar soup for the first time and loved it, as well as the chipotle chicken sandwich. Thanks for the attention.
Good food and location.

Was at this store at 12:06 12/31/18.  I ordered Roasted Turkey & Avocado Sdw with Butter Croissant and NO BACON.  Got to work and what did I get? Roasted Turkey on some hard bread and BACON plus the salad greens were brown.  I called three times to speak to a manager.  Of course the phone rang, rang and left no opportunity to leave a message. Cafe Order Number 36338 Order check by #17.  I just paid $10.60 for a  sandwich  I cannot eat.  Reading is fundamental.  Read the orders that what I ask.  Now I have to burn up my gas to go back to the store.  I am contacting the  corporate office since there is no resolution with the manager.
It's Panera.
The broccoli cheddar soup and chicken Fuji apple salad was delicious!
Over rated
Nice people make lunch more enjoyable.
Good
Drive through services is quick and the food taste great
It never fails but anytime I call to place a pick up order at this specific Panera, they NEVER pick the phone up.

I love their food. Not happy with their prices. I can always find food I love. I totally miss their Cuban sandwich. Love the bagels and honey Walnut cream cheese. Breakfast is not so bad as far as price if you are getting a bagel. The breakfast souffle are wonderful. Asian salad I love. You can definitely find something you love.
I had clam crowder soup, bread and water and it was delicious.....Like to go on Fri. when they have this..better try it!!!
How the heck did you care about id
Some of the Best Chicken Noodle soup in a while!
I said it before and I'll say it again Bandera's has gone downhill not nearly as good as they used to be and the prices continue to rise
bad they always in a hurry,and they never give you the correct bread.
The wait was 30 minuets for a bowl of Mac and Cheese. No body was in the store. The food came out cold.
great
Great Service! Tasty Food! Very Busy during lunch.
Excellent meal! Great atmosphere.
Standard breakfast order.  It was hastily put together and slid all over the inside of my to go bag... again.

I love Panera's broccoli cheese soup! The new Caprese sandwich was delicious! And for my birthday, I got a free kitchen sink cookie which lasted me 2 days because it's huge and really good/sweet. Staff was super sweet! I had a great time with my friends!

Only thing that could be improved on is pricing... 3 lunches shouldn't be $40!
I love it the food is so good!!

Very clean place the help is very good even if there's a long line you get through quick and get your seat the food is good you can look around the mall and very reasonable price on food along with a high rating

This is a decent place to grab a bite to eat, however they frequently run out of things. Last time I was there they ran out of romaine and I saw a customer have to settle on a sandwich instead of his salad. Many times my togo orders have been erroneous. And more times than not they are out of fruit cups. I still eat here, but only out of convenience, not satisfaction.
Good food, good choices to choose from

Its a Panera.  Their system for pickup orders baffles me.  People stand around where the wait staff pickup.  They have a board where customers can see that the order is ready, but people still stand in the aisle clueless about blocking up the passageway.

They have crammed so many tables and chairs into a small space, very difficult to get to a table without climbing over other customers. Not wheelchair friendly. Food was OK but expensive. Probably not going to come back.

02-26-17 First time visiting this store. I had a not so pleasant experience with an employee by the name of Michael. It was not only was the level of customer service given but I left feeling discriminated against. The manager on duty with whom I spoke with was very understanding and a wonderful person when I called in to voice my opinion. To the management, please consider speaking to the employees about the inportance of not only customer service but even the simple way to make sure your customers are treated equally.

Just a quick note to say they take care of you here. Ordered online, picked up the order, realized one small part was missing when we got home. Sent a *different person* (me) from our group back to get it. They didn't even question it, just immediately got the missing item for me happily and quickly. They were very apologetic even though I told them it was no big deal. They wouldn't let me walk out the door without taking a small dessert piece for my trouble. Smiling faces all around.

We appreciated their effort and good attitude. As far as the food, it's Panera - always reliable.

Past its prime. I tried to use the keyosk since the line was so long. The machine wouldn't read any credit cards to pay for my order,  so I had to wait in line anyway. The food took forever to arrive and when it did, my order was wrong even though the report that came with the food clearly had my order correct. They corrected my order immediately, though I did not get a "treat" for my troubles as the order receipt clearly states. My sandwich, The Italian, was very different than I remember. Must be that "clean food" thing.  My fault for not checking the ingredients more closely.  It's just not the old Panera that I used to like so much.
Food is never takes that long to get out
Our delivery person benjamin was so nice!
Good food

I really need to stop coming to Panera. At least the soup was warm today and I didn't have to clear my table before I sat down. The apple was mostly bruises and the Caesar salad was wilted. Sad to say these things.

Parking is generally awful. The shopping center is too busy and they never took into account the extra traffic. Panera also seems to have changed their cream cheese around and it's awful now. Still will order for a quick lunch and get a salad.
